verses.verse: And Ben<WH1130>–hadad the king<WH4428> of Syria<WH758> gathered<WH6908> all his army<WH2428> together<WH6908>: and there were thirty<WH7970> and two<WH8147> kings<WH4428> with him<WH5483>, and horses, and chariots<WH7393>: and he went up<WH5927> and besieged<WH6696> Samaria<WH8111>, and warred against it<WH3898>.

And all the elders<WH2205> and all the people<WH5971> said<WH559> unto him<WH8085>, Listen not unto him<WH14>, nor consent.

That is why he said<WH559> unto the messengers<WH4397> of Ben<WH1130>–hadad, Tell<WH559> my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>, All that you did send<WH7971> for to your servant<WH5650> at the first<WH7223> I will do<WH6213>: but this thing<WH1697> I may<WH3201> not do<WH6213>. And Ben<WH1130>–hadad sent<WH7971> unto him<WH559>, and said, The gods<WH430> do so<WH6213> unto me<WH3254>, and more also, if the dust<WH6083> of Samaria<WH8111> shall suffice<WH5606> for handfuls<WH8168> for all the people<WH5971> that follow me<WH7272>.
And the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Tell<WH1696> him<WH2296>, Let not him that puts on his harness boast<WH1984> himself as he that puts it off<WH6605>.

And it came to pass<WH8085>, when Ben–hadad heard this message<WH1697>, as he was drinking<WH8354>, he and the kings<WH4428> in the pavilions<WH5521>, that he said<WH559> unto his servants<WH5650>, Set<WH7760> yourselves in array<WH7760>. And they set themselves in array against the city<WH5892>.

And Ahab<WH256> said<WH559>, By whom<WH559>? And he said, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, Even by the young men<WH5288> of the princes<WH8269> of the provinces<WH4082>. Then he said<WH559>, Who shall order<WH631> the battle<WH4421>? And he answered<WH559>, You.

And the servants<WH5650> of the king<WH4428> of Syria<WH758> said<WH559> unto him<WH430>, Their gods are gods<WH430> of the hills<WH2022>; therefore they were stronger<WH2388> than we<WH199>; but let us fight<WH3898> against them in the plain<WH4334>, and surely<WH3808> we shall be stronger than they<WH2388>.

And it came to pass at the return<WH8666> of the year<WH8141>, that Ben<WH1130>–hadad numbered<WH6485> the Syrians<WH758>, and went up<WH5927> to Aphek<WH663>, to fight<WH4421> against Israel<WH3478>.

And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> were numbered<WH6485>, and were all present<WH3557>, and went<WH3212> against<WH7125> them<WH1121>: and the sons of Israel<WH3478> pitched<WH2583> before them like two<WH8147> little flocks<WH2835> of kids<WH5795>; but the Syrians<WH758> filled<WH4390> the country<WH776>.

And there came<WH5066> a man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and spoke<WH559> unto the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>, and said<WH559>, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, Because the Syrians<WH758> have said<WH559>, The Lord<WH3068> is God<WH430> of the hills<WH2022>, but he is not God<WH430> of the valleys<WH6010>, therefore will I deliver<WH5414> all this great<WH1419> multitude<WH1995> into your hand<WH3027>, and you shall know<WH3045> that I am the Lord<WH3068>.

And they pitched<WH2583> one<WH428> over against<WH5227> the other<WH428> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>. And so it was<WH7637>, that in the seventh day<WH3117> the battle<WH4421> was joined<WH7126>: and the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> killed<WH5221> of the Syrians<WH758> an hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> footmen<WH7273> in one<WH259> day<WH3117>.

But the rest<WH3498> fled<WH5127> to Aphek<WH663>, into the city<WH5892>; and there a wall<WH2346> fell<WH5307> upon twenty<WH6242> and seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> of the men<WH376> that were left<WH3498>. And his servants<WH5650> said<WH559> unto him<WH8085>, Behold now, we have heard that the kings<WH4428> of the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> are merciful<WH2617> kings<WH4428>: let us<WH7760>, I pray you, put sackcloth<WH8242> on our body<WH4975>, and ropes<WH2256> upon our heads<WH7218>, and go out<WH3318> to the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>: perhaps he will save<WH2421> your life<WH5315>.

So they girded<WH2296> sackcloth<WH8242> on their body<WH4975>, and put ropes<WH2256> on their heads<WH7218>, and came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>, and said<WH559>, Your servant<WH5650> Ben<WH1130>–hadad says<WH559>, I pray you<WH2421>, let me live. Now the men<WH582> did diligently observe<WH5172> whether any thing would come from him<WH4116>, and did hastily catch<WH2480> it<WH559>: and they said, Your brother<WH251> Ben<WH1130>–hadad. Then he said<WH559>, Go<WH935> you<WH3947>, bring him<WH1130>. Then Ben–hadad came forth<WH3318> to him<WH5927>; and he caused him to come up into the chariot<WH4818>.

And Ben<WH559>–hadad said unto him<WH5892>, The cities, which my father<WH1> took<WH3947> from your father<WH1>, I will restore<WH7725>; and you shall make<WH7760> streets<WH2351> for you in Damascus<WH1834>, as my father<WH1> made<WH7760> in Samaria<WH8111>. Then said Ahab<WH7971>, I will send you away with this covenant<WH1285>. So he made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with him<WH7971>, and sent him away.

And a certain<WH259> man<WH376> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> said<WH559> unto his neighbor<WH7453> in the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>, Strike<WH5221> me<WH376>, I pray you. And the man refused<WH3985> to strike him<WH5221>.

Then said<WH559> he unto him<WH8085>, Because you have not obeyed the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH3068>, behold<WH1980>, as soon as you are departed from me<WH738>, a lion shall kill<WH5221> you<WH3212>. And the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> to his house<WH1004> heavy<WH5620> and displeased<WH2198>, and came<WH935> to Samaria<WH8111>.
